docs.snippet: While the social media company cooperated with the research, it tracks other findings that social ties are linked to longevity.

headline.main: Facebook Could Be Associated With a Longer Life, Study Finds

docs.snippet: The social media network was leaving out videos viewed for less than three seconds, which greatly inflated the figures presented to advertisers and publishers.

headline.main: Facebook Apologizes for Overstating Video Metrics

docs.abstract: Facebook apologizes for error that for years greatly overstated amount of time users spent watching videos on website; 'discrepancy' is problematic for partners, advertisers and publishers.

docs.snippet: Cyn Coco said she filled more than a dozen garbage bags with trash after thousands of Christmas revelers in Australia celebrated on suburban Coogee Beach.

headline.main: A Sydney Resident Shows Beach Trashed By Revelers

docs.snippet: The social media giant says a technical issue allowed inappropriate content to be offered for sale.

headline.print_headline: New Facebook App’s Flaw: Sex, Guns and Hedgehogs
headline.main: Facebook Marketplace Goes Wrong: Sex, Guns and Baby Hedgehogs

docs.abstract: Facebook apologizes for allowing inappropriate and offensive posts on Marketplace, its forum for buying and selling things, just hours after launch; says technical issue prevented company from identifying posts that violated commerce policies and community standards.

docs.snippet: A 17-word reminder displayed for four days in September contributed to substantial increases in online registration across the country.

headline.main: Facebook Helped Drive a Voter Registration Surge, Election Officials Say

docs.snippet: Mike Isaac, a reporter for The New York Times, weighs in on Facebook’s new censorship software, which was created to help it get back into China.

headline.sub: Isaac: Facebook is thinking more pragmatically

docs.snippet: Hoaxes are not just bouncing around among conspiracy theorists; candidates and elected officials are sharing them, too.

headline.print_headline: The Digital Virus Called Fake News
headline.main: Facebook and the Digital Virus Called Fake News

docs.snippet: You probably already use Facebook at work. Now, Facebook is creating a separate version aimed at helping you do actual work instead of catching up on baby photos and campaign chatter.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Launches 'Workplace' a Business Version of Facebook
headline.main: Facebook Launches 'Workplace' a Business Version of Facebook

docs.snippet: The social media giant is fighting back against people who use ad blocking technology on their personal computers.
